title: Accessing Rangeland Analysis Platform (RAP) Gridded Products with R
text: Now select just "annual forb grass biomass" layers, iterate plot symbolizing common range [0,500] pounds per acre. Using {gifski} package save_gif() function can easily create animated graphic RAP predictions. write iteration function called makeplot() use {gifski} render animated GIF file R plot graphics output year total 36 layers.
code: makeplot <- function() {   lapply(grep("annual_forb_and_grass_biomass", names(rap)), function(i) {     terra::plot(rap[[i]],                  main = names(rap)[i],                  range = c(0, 500),                  cex.main = TRUE)     terra::plot(p, type ="continuous", add = TRUE)   }) } library(gifski)  # create GIF from results  gifski::save_gif(makeplot(),                   gif_file = "annual_forb_and_grass_biomass.gif",                   delay = 0.5)

title: Authors and Citation
text: Andrew Brown. Author, maintainer. Georgia Harrison. Contributor.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Andrew Brown (2022). rapr: Interface Rangeland Analysis Platform (RAP) Vegetation Biomass Cover Products. R package version 0.1.0. http://github.com/brownag/rapr Jones, M.O., N.P. Robinson, D.E. Naugle, J.D. Maestas, M.C. Reeves, R.W. Lankston, B.W. Allred. 2021. Annual 16-Day Rangeland Production Estimates Western United States. Rangeland Ecology & Management 77:112-117. http://dx.doi.org/10.1016/j.rama.2021.04.003 Robinson, N. P., M. O. Jones, . Moreno, T. . Erickson, D. E. Naugle, B. W. Allred. 2019. Rangeland productivity partitioned sub-pixel plant functional types. Remote Sensing 11:1427. http://dx.doi.org/10.3390/rs11121427 Allred, B. W., B. T. Bestelmeyer, C. S. Boyd, C. Brown, K. W. Davies, L. M. Ellsworth, T. . Erickson, S. D. Fuhlendorf, T. V. Griffiths, V. Jansen, M. O. Jones, J. Karl, J. D. Maestas, J. J. Maynard, S. E. McCord, D. E. Naugle, H. D. Starns, D. Twidwell, D. R. Uden. 2021. Improving Landsat predictions rangeland fractional cover multitask learning uncertainty. Methods Ecology Evolution. http://dx.doi.org/10.1111/2041-210x.13564

what: Interface to Rangeland Analysis Platform (RAP) Vegetation Biomass and Cover Products
title: Interface to Rangeland Analysis Platform (RAP) Vegetation Biomass and Cover Products
text: goal {rapr} provide simple R interface Rangeland Analysis Platform (RAP) Vegetation Biomass Cover Products. See https://rangelands.app/products citation("rapr") information products. can query annual biomass cover (versions 2 3) years 1986 present. product = "vegetation-biomass" returns two layers year: "annual forb grass", "perennial forb grass" (lbs / acre). product = "vegetation-cover" returns six layers year: "annual forb grass", "bare ground", "litter", "perennial forb grass", "shrub", "tree" (% cover)

title: Interface to Rangeland Analysis Platform (RAP) Vegetation Biomass and Cover Products
text: can install development version {rapr} GitHub :

title: Interface to Rangeland Analysis Platform (RAP) Vegetation Biomass and Cover Products
text: example shows use {terra} SpatVector containing rectangular polygon rapr::get_rap() obtain RAP grids corresponding extent. {terra}, {raster}, {sf} {sp} objects supported input types. spatial object used Coordinate Reference System defined, input coordinates projected source data Coordinate Reference System RAP grids (WGS84 decimal degrees / "EPSG:4326").  filename argument specified, unique temporary files generated. resulting SpatRaster object retain reference files, can remove manually unlink(terra::sources(<SpatRaster>)). filename specified, temporary files removed result (often multi- year/layer/product) SpatRaster written new file. lieu spatial object {terra}, {raster}, {sf} {sp} packages may specify bounding box using numeric vector containing xmin, ymax, xmax, ymin WGS84 longitude/latitude decimal degrees (corresponding order used gdal_translate -projwin option). e.g. get_rap(x = c(-120, 37, -119.99, 36.99), ...).
code: library(terra) #> terra 1.7.73 library(rapr)  res <- get_rap(   vect("POLYGON ((-120 36.99,-119.99 37,-120 37,-120 36.99))",        crs = "EPSG:4326"),    version = "v3",   year = c(1986, 1996, 2006, 2016),   progress = FALSE )  res #> class       : SpatRaster  #> dimensions  : 37, 37, 32  (nrow, ncol, nlyr) #> resolution  : 0.0002694946, 0.0002694946  (x, y) #> extent      : -120, -119.99, 36.99029, 37.00026  (xmin, xmax, ymin, ymax) #> coord. ref. : lon/lat WGS 84 (EPSG:4326)  #> sources     : 1986vegetation-biomassv3_9134597a43b6.tif  (2 layers)  #>               1996vegetation-biomassv3_913468b723c8.tif  (2 layers)  #>               2006vegetation-biomassv3_913434c539ef.tif  (2 layers)  #>               ... and 5 more source(s) #> names       : annua~86_v3, peren~86_v3, annua~96_v3, peren~96_v3, annua~06_v3, peren~06_v3, ...  plot(res) (1: xmin, 2: ymax)--------------------------|         |                                   |         |         TARGET EXTENT             |         |  x = c(xmin, ymax, xmax, ymin)    |         |                                   |         |---------------------------(3: xmax, 4: ymin)

title: Interface to Rangeland Analysis Platform (RAP) Vegetation Biomass and Cover Products

R package version 0.1.0. #>   http://github.com/brownag/rapr #>  #>   Jones, M.O., N.P. Robinson, D.E. Naugle, J.D. Maestas, M.C. Reeves, #>   R.W. Lankston, and B.W. Allred. 2021. Annual and 16-Day Rangeland #>   Production Estimates for the Western United States. Rangeland Ecology #>   & Management 77:112-117. http://dx.doi.org/10.1016/j.rama.2021.04.003 #>  #>   Robinson, N. P., M. O. Jones, A. Moreno, T. A. Erickson, D. E. #>   Naugle, and B. W. Allred. 2019. Rangeland productivity partitioned to #>   sub-pixel plant functional types. Remote Sensing 11:1427. #>   http://dx.doi.org/10.3390/rs11121427 #>  #>   Allred, B. W., B. T. Bestelmeyer, C. S. Boyd, C. Brown, K. W. Davies, #>   L. M. Ellsworth, T. A. Erickson, S. D. Fuhlendorf, T. V. Griffiths, #>   V. Jansen, M. O. Jones, J. Karl, J. D. Maestas, J. J. Maynard, S. E. #>   McCord, D. E. Naugle, H. D. Starns, D. Twidwell, and D. R. Uden. #>   2021. Improving Landsat predictions of rangeland fractional cover #>   with multitask learning and uncertainty. Methods in Ecology and #>   Evolution. http://dx.doi.org/10.1111/2041-210x.13564 #>  #> To see these entries in BibTeX format, use 'print(<citation>, #> bibtex=TRUE)', 'toBibtex(.)', or set #> 'options(citation.bibtex.max=999)'.

what: Get Rangeland Analysis Platform (RAP) Grids — get_rap
title: Get Rangeland Analysis Platform (RAP) Grids — get_rap
text: Get Rangeland Analysis Platform (RAP) Grids

title: Get Rangeland Analysis Platform (RAP) Grids — get_rap
code: get_rap(   x,   years = c(1986, 1996, 2006, 2016),   filename = NULL,   product = c("vegetation-biomass", "vegetation-cover"),   version = "v3",   progress = NULL )

title: Get Rangeland Analysis Platform (RAP) Grids — get_rap
text: x Target extent. Derived sf, terra, raster sp object numeric vector containing xmin, ymax, xmax, ymin WGS84 longitude/latitude decimal degrees (EPSG:4326). years integer. Year(s) query filename Output filename (optional; default stores temporary files, see terra::sources()) product Target data: "vegetation-biomass" /"vegetation-cover" version Target version: "v3" /"v2" progress logical. Show progress bar? Default: missing (NULL) use progress bar three layers requested.

title: Get Rangeland Analysis Platform (RAP) Grids — get_rap
text: SpatRaster containing requested vegetation-biomass /vegetation-cover layers year. Native cell resolution ~30m x 30m WGS84 decimal degrees.

title: Get Rangeland Analysis Platform (RAP) Grids — get_rap
text: can query annual biomass cover (versions 2 3) 1986 present product = "vegetation-biomass" returns two layers per year: "annual forb grass", "perennial forb grass" (lbs / acre) product = "vegetation-cover" returns six layers per year: "annual forb grass", "bare ground", "litter", "perennial forb grass", "shrub", "tree" (% cover) filename argument specified, unique temporary files generated. resulting SpatRaster object retain reference files, can remove manually unlink(terra::sources(<SpatRaster)). filename specified, temporary files removed result (often multi- year/layer/product) SpatRaster written new file. lieu spatial object {terra}, {raster}, {sf} {sp}  packages may specify bounding box using numeric vector containing xmin, ymax, xmax, ymin WGS84 longitude/latitude decimal degrees (corresponding order used gdal_translate -projwin option). e.g. get_rap(x = c(-120, 37, -119.99, 36.99), ...).

what: rapr: Interface to Rangeland Analysis Platform (RAP) Vegetation Biomass and Cover Products — rapr-package
title: rapr: Interface to Rangeland Analysis Platform (RAP) Vegetation Biomass and Cover Products — rapr-package
text: Provides access Rangeland Analysis Platform (RAP) products https://rangelands.app/products arbitrary extents via GDAL virtual file system.

title: rapr 0.1.1
text: Updated default arguments get_rap() Added new vignette titled “Accessing Rangeland Analysis Platform (RAP) Gridded Data R” Added NEWS.md file track changes package.
